content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												This is my only review I have written in my steam lifetime. As a football fan, draft nut and a lover of statistics, this game delivers everything I want. I love tinkering with contracts, drafting the best players, and managing my team to be a super bowl contender every season. You can create your own team and even your own players, pick a year in NFL history and draft all incoming real players from that point on. The guy who wrote the first review must not be a numbers guy. I spent the full $10 on this game and do not regret it. In fact, I'm having a lovely time on my laptop by myself, thank you very much. Buy this game and have fun. Remember, it's text based, so it's not like real time football like Madden. Either way you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												A very fun heavy simulation type football game that uses real NFL players. Very similar to Franchise Hockey Manager in terms of gameplay and menu UI. You can choose to start an NFL season starting from 1970 to 2013 with all the real players from those teams! One of a few American Football games currently on Steam.

Posted: August 30, 2015
												While this game does have some flaws, then again all games do have them. I have found this game to be extremely enjoyable. I love the fact you can play historical seasons with real players. I would love it if you could set your own depth chart, the auto sort feature does have some flaws. Otherwise it's a blast to play, and since i only paid $5 for it I can't complain since I wasn't going to pay $25 for FOF. I wish they would come out with a Basketball Mogul that would be an instant buy for me.

Posted: June 8, 2015
												Terrible. No semblance of realism, game interface is confusing, player ratings make no sense, completely outdated (Accurate to the start of 2013 season) playcalling is flawed, cannot set your own depth chart, injured players can play...I could go on and on. This is a complete waste of money. If you want a football sim, get Front Office Football 7 instead. It is infinitely better in every possible way.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												The sports equivalent of Gratuitous Space Battle.  It is competent...yet very dry, flawed and unengaging.  +The game is only a 200mb download and runs in your web browser.  -There are no sound effects or music.  The lack of small touches that are missed definitely add up.  -The interface and options are bland and simplistic.   -There does not appear to be a way to adjust your lineup during a game...wow.-Playbook consists of the same 50 generic plays regardless of team.  (There is an option to make custom playbooks however, but also looks dry and unclear how the game will actually let you benefit)   -The game is missing a whole lot of "fun factor" without much in the way of a distinctive personality.  -In order to have fun with this, the player needs to have a particular personality/mood.  -Dealbreaker:  The realism is off big-time.  I played on "head coach" difficulty with the 2013 Miami Dolphins for 4 games/2+hrs.  I haven't played any other difficulty setting thus far, and frankly don't care to.  If the game is going to have my field goal kicker kick just 40% from under 40 yards...I have a problem.  If my defense gives up over 240 yrds/7yds per carry on average...per game when I am keying against the run to stop the trend...I have a problem. I really wasn't expecting much from this game, so it is with exceptional regret that I declare this to be a fail.  In hindsight, I dropped 10 bucks on something so reminiscent of 1997 shareware and should have spent more time looking at reviews/youtube.  For a game with "2014" in the label, this is rather sad. Score: 5.0/10
